newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Rostelekom hopes resolve row on ADR issue.
newsitem.headline: Russian Rostelekom hopes resolve row on ADR issue.

text.p: Russian telecoms company Rostelekom hopes to resolve a dispute which could hold up plans for an issue of American Depositary Receipts (ADRs), a senior company official said on Friday.

Igor Kocheshkov, head of Rostelekom's securities department, said the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission was demanding the firm take responsibility for the actions of its independent share registrar.
The SEC must approve plans for issues of ADRs, securities which allow U.S. investors to control foreign shares without settlement problems in the issuer's market.
Kocheshkov said Rostelekom could not take blanket responsibility for all actions of the registry company, Irkol, as it could not guarantee that level of control.
He said Rostelekom hoped to go ahead with an issue of Level One ADRs but that it was too soon to discuss terms.
"We can only talk about the conditions when this question which, in principle, does not allow the programme to go ahead, is resolved," he said.
Kocheshkov said similar demands were put to all Russian companies wishing to issue ADRs.
"In so far as an ADR programme increases liquidity, we would like the programme to go ahead," he said.
